strategy: Adopt a time-varying mixed strategy where the row player randomizes between coordinating (both choose the same option) and misaligning (choosing different options) based on the observed history of the opponent’s previous move. Specifically, if the opponent chose "Movie" in the previous round, the row player selects "Game" with 70% probability and "Movie" with 30%; otherwise, they select "Movie" with 70% and "Game" with 30%. This introduces temporal dependence and adaptive learning to exploit patterns in opponent behavior.
